column2: Rating scale definitions for scores 5 and 1 (highest versus lowest)

column1: Patients identified this novel endpoint as important to them
column2:
5 -- Patients have identified this novel endpoint as measuring an reflect an aspect of the disease or illness that is important to them
1 -- Patients were not involved in the identification of this novel endpoint

column1: This novel endpoint addresses an unmet need
column2:
5 – There is high unmet need in this therapeutic area because no high quality, validated, and efficient endpoints exist 
1 – There is no unmet need in this therapeutic area because high quality, validated, and efficient endpoints already exist

column1: There is benefit from collecting data to generate the novel endpoint in the real-world in real-time
column2:
5 – Collecting data in real-time would be of significant benefit to endpoints in this therapeutic area 
1 – Collecting data in real-time would not be of any significant improvement to endpoints in this therapeutic area

column1: The digital technology used for this novel endpoint reduces participation burden to patients and their caregivers
column2:
5 – Collecting data using digital technology for this endpoint in this therapeutic area would significantly reduce the burden of collecting data for patients and their caregivers 
1 – Collecting data using digital technology for this endpoint in this therapeutic area would significantly increase the burden of collecting data for patients and their caregivers

column1: This novel endpoint is for a significant disease/health condition
column2:
5 – This novel endpoint is for a disease/health condition that is very significant 
1 – This novel endpoint addresses a disease/health condition that is insignificant

column1: The digital technology used to generate data for this novel endpoint is easily tolerated by the patient/caregiver
column2:
5 – The digital technology used to generate data for this novel endpoint is very easy for the patient/caregiver to tolerate 
1 – The digital technology used to generate data for this novel endpoint is very difficult for the patient/caregiver to tolerate

column1: The use of this novel endpoint allows a broader population to participate in clinical trials
column2:
5 – Use of this novel endpoint is very likely to broaden the populations able to participate 
1 – Use of this novel endpoint is very unlikely to broaden the populations who are able to participate

column1: This novel endpoint is easily comprehensible
column2:
5 – The outcome is easy to comprehend   
1 – The outcome is difficult to comprehend

column1: The digital technology used to measure this novel endpoint is advanced in its development
column2:
5 – The digital technology used to measure this novel endpoint is advanced in its development 
1 – The digital technology used to measure this novel endpoint is in the very early stages of development

column1: The digital technology used to generate data for this novel endpoint has the ability to measure multiple endpoints
column2:
5 – The digital technology used to generate data for this novel endpoint currently can be used to measure many novel endpoints 
1 – The digital technology used to generate data for this novel endpoint currently can only be used to measure this one novel endpoint

column1: Use of this novel endpoint reduces work for study personnel
column2:
5 – Collecting data using digital technology for this endpoint in this therapeutic area would significantly reduce the volume of work on study personnel 
1 – Collecting data using digital technology for this endpoint in this therapeutic area would have no impact on the volume of work for study personnel

column1: The digital technology used for this novel endpoint is adaptable across multiple disease or therapeutic areas
column2:
5 – The digital technology used to generate data for this novel endpoint could be used to measure many novel endpoints across many therapeutic areas 
1 – The digital technology used to generate data for this novel endpoint could only be used to measure this novel endpoint or endpoints within this one therapeutic area

column1: This novel endpoint may be used in a therapeutic area that is amenable to potential collaboration
column2:
5 – Collaboration to expedite the validation of this novel endpoint is highly likely
1 – Collaboration to expedite the validation of this novel endpoint is highly unlikely

column1: The digital technology used to measure this novel endpoint helps reduce bias during outcome ascertainment
column2:
5 – The digital technology used for this novel endpoint offers new opportunity for unbiased outcome ascertainment 
1 – The digital technology used for this novel endpoint offers no new opportunity for unbiased outcome ascertainment
